insufferable_academic.000: Fasting for a day merely offers an opportunity to observe the wailings of my monkey mind.
insufferable_academic.001: A day without food is an excellent way to sharpen the mind.
insufferable_academic.002: According to my research, people need to consume at least twenty four units of energy each day to mantain proper function.

hopeless_optimist.000: Wow, I went a whole 24 hours without food!
hopeless_optimist.001: No food by midnight? Maybe I can drink moonlight.
hopeless_optimist.002: So hungry... maybe tomorrow we'll find more berries.

beleaguered_leader.000: It's just 24 hours without food. Don't panic.
beleaguered_leader.002: I'm going to dream about food tonight.
beleaguered_leader.003: A whole day without food? Musn't complain; got to set a good example.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: A whole day without food? My stomach is going to start eating itself.
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: Went a whole day without eating a single thing. Tomorrow, my 'friends' had better watch out.
psychopathic_misanthrope.002: I may not have eaten all day today, but I'm still a badass.
psychopathic_misanthrope.003: No food in camp today, huh? Maybe I can find something in the forest to kill tomorrow.

generic.001: I wish I had something to eat.
generic.002: Going a who day without food makes me so, so sad.

diligent_sweetheart.000: It's okay, I don't need to eat every day.
diligent_sweetheart.001: By the precepts of the Church of Plenty, we should eat at least once a day.

teacher.000: A day without food? At home we used to go a whole week for the festival of [str(entry.teacher)]!

lovable_rogue.000: 24 hours without food? I'm sure I could find an opportunity here, if I weren't so hungry.
lovable_rogue.001: Nobody's eaten in a while. I could make a killing if I just had one of mom's apple pies.
lovable_rogue.002: Going without food for a whole day is surprisingly hard.

beleaguered_leader.000: I don't know how long we can last without food.
beleaguered_leader.001: Has anyone found any animals to eat yet?
beleaguered_leader.002: Keep on the lookout for berry bushes, or something!
beleaguered_leader.004: I have to stop dreaming about food every night.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: Is there anyone around here I can eat?
psychopathic_misanthrope.001: I need to kill something small and furry.

diligent_sweetheart.000: I'm so hungry... Step 1: Learn carpentry!
diligent_sweetheart.001: It's okay, I didn't really need to eat today.
diligent_sweetheart.002: I wish I could bake a cheesecake.
diligent_sweetheart.003: If we huddle around the fire at night, that's almost as good as eating, right?
diligent_sweetheart.004: I really don't want to die here.

teacher.000: [str(entry.teacher)], even if I don't make it, keep my friends safe, okay?

lovable_rogue.000: In retrospect, I really should have hoarded those berries.
lovable_rogue.001: It's a pity you can't eat silver and gold.
lovable_rogue.002: That wood is starting to look like chocolate...

teacher.000: As [str(entry.teacher)] is my witness, I will never go hungry again!

insufferable_academic.000: Hunger is merely a state of mind.
insufferable_academic.001: To be, or not to be, that is the question...
insufferable_academic.002: The needs of the stomach are merely a distraction from the pursuits of the mind.
insufferable_academic.004: I refuse to allow my vast intellect to succumb to base starvation!
insufferable_academic.005: According to my research, people need to consume at least twenty four units of energy each day to mantain proper function.

hopeless_optimist.000: Oh, great! Another day without food... That's exactly that little push I needed for starting my diet!
hopeless_optimist.001: Hunger really sharpens the colors in the world!
hopeless_optimist.002: I think there's a hole in my stomach.

generic.001: If I could just get some food, maybe my stomach would feel better.
generic.002: I don't know how much longer I can go without food.

psychopathic_misanthrope.000: You want me to be the weaver? Everything I know about weaving: jab the pointy end into the other person. This should be interesting.

hopeless_optimist.000: Woo! Now that I'm the weaver, I live to make comfy beds for everyone!

insufferable_academic.000: There is a meditative grace in fine knotwork. Stare, my friends, stare until your souls belong to meeeeee.

beleaguered_leader.000: I don't know... I always expected a more epic role in life. Well, this will probably be good for my blood pressure.

lovable_rogue.000: Hmm... if a spider is a weaver, is a weaver like a spider? Everyone shall sleep safe in my webs. ...Was that too creepy?

diligent_sweetheart.000: Oh! First thing's first--time to make everyone a new winter scarf!

party.description: Organizes troops into groups for combat

insane_alligator.description: Smaller varanuses tend to flock around them.

step005.title: Click X to close this window

step004.title: Click the Craft button to craft the workshop

step001.title: Open the workshop menu
step001.description: Use this menu to manage the various crafting workshops of your citizens.

step000.title: Set Up a Workbench
step000.description: Our carpenter needs a crafting station in order to craft items for the town. Let's make a workbench!

step001.title: Open the Build Menu
step001.description: Use this menu to build structures and place items in your town.

step000.title: Place the Carpenter's Workbench
step000.description: Now that we've crafted the workbench, we need to place it in town for the Carpenter to use.

step003.title: Click the Carpenter's Workshop item
step003.description: Select the workshop and click to place it somewhere in town.

step000.title: Congratulations!
step000.description: We've got resources, a place to store goods, and a way to craft items. We're well on our way to getting this settlement off the ground!

scenario_data.declined_text: I don't need a tutorial -- I know what to do!

food_for_days.description: The large amount of food crammed into the back of the caravan should keep the hearthlings going for a handful of days while they get their settlement up and running.
food_for_days.tooltip: A safe option for new players, though lacking in defense.

merchant_caravan.description: A collection of trade tools should give the settlement a leg up in the wilderness.
merchant_caravan.tooltip: A good collection of craft skills, but short on food.

money_solves_all_problems.description: Anything that the town needs they should be able to purchase from a trader.  That is, presuming one finds them and has the proper goods for sale...
money_solves_all_problems.tooltip: A risky but potentially very beneficial choice.  It all depends on when and what traders arrive.

animal_companion_trait.description: Ever since [name(i18n_data.savior)] saved their [str(i18n_data.species)] from mortal danger, they've been inseparable.

herbivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is a friend to all animals! Plants, less so.

callous_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)]  keeps everyone at arms length. This helps them to not be as hurt when tragedy occurs around them, but their constant guarded composure makes them slow to make friends.

carnivore_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] just LOVES animals! Especially with hot sauce.

courageous_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves to save others, and puts the safety of the town as paramount.

excitable_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] can never seem to keep their emotions in check, so they become happy or sad much faster than normal.

green_thumb_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] seems to have a way with plants that is somewhat indescribable.

heart_of_a_crafter_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] loves crafting things for others. If they don't make at least one thing a day, they feel the day is wasted.

professor_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] always likes to give advice to others based on their observations, whether the receiver wants it or not.

featherweight_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] likes to walk a bit faster than others, though they tend to carry less as a result.

pack_mule_trait.description: This hearthling can move mountains! They can carry more in their pack, but walk slightly slower when it's full due to the weight.

glutton_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)]'s stomach might as well be a portal to another world for as much as they're able to eat. Maybe that explains a bit of their resilience, though.

hothead_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] never voluntarily backs down from a fight. Even from ones they probably should...

night_owl_trait.description: The day only really begins once the sun has set.

optimistic_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] always looks on the bright side, and sees a silver lining in almost everything.

passion_job_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] always dreamed of being a [str(i18n_data.passion_job)], maybe now they'll get their chance?

pessimistic_trait.description: [name(i18n_data.entity)] is a glass half-empty kinda person.

cultist_trait.description: This hearthling keeps mumbling about some sort of secret "bunny god" sleeping eternally. What's that about?

hungry.tooltip: I could really go for a good meal.

famished.tooltip: It's been awhile since I've eaten. I really need some food!

starving.tooltip: My stomach is in knots!  If I don't find something to eat soon...

stuffed.tooltip: My last meal was so filling I won't need to eat again for a bit.

spacious.tooltip: There's so much open space around here. It really makes me feel at ease.

cramped.tooltip: I'm feeling rather cramped. I always have to watch my step not to bump into anything.

very_cramped.tooltip: This place is suffocating! There's barely room to breathe!

dark.tooltip: This area isn't very well lit.

pain_scratched.tooltip: I'm a little worse for wear.

slept_on_ground.tooltip: My back is killing me from having slept on the ground. When are we going to get some decent beds?

slept_in_shared_bed.tooltip: I'm sharing my bed with someone else right now. It's not the worst, but I really wish I had my own.

slept_in_shared_room.tooltip: I'm sharing my room with someone else right now. I could use a little more privacy.

slept_outside.tooltip: I wish I had some shelter and protection from the elements.

slept_in_comfy_bed.tooltip: My bed is really comfortable. I felt refreshed when I woke up!

ate_unpalatable.tooltip: Eating [str(foodname)] was one of the poorer choices I made today.

herbivore_ate_meat.tooltip: I can't believe I ate a [str(foodname)].  I can just imagine how cute it must have looked... before...

carnivore_ate_veggies.tooltip: There's been a mistake.  I've accidentally eaten food that my food eats.

ate_fine.tooltip: My recent meal was amazing! Whoever made the [str(foodname)] really put their heart into it.

ate_tasty.tooltip: The [str(foodname)] I ate was pretty tasty! I still remember the combination of flavors.

ate_raw.tooltip: I recently ate a raw [str(foodname)]. I can only imagine how much better it would have tasted were it cooked.

ate_bland.tooltip: I remember eating a bland [str(foodname)]. It gave me the strength to keep going, but the meal was so boring.

ate_cooked.tooltip: I always enjoy the 'warm belly' feeling after a nice prepared meal.

pioneering_spirit.tooltip: We've left our home to build a new one. We will make it better than before!

settling_in.tooltip: I'm starting to feel at home, but there's work yet to be done.

level_2.tooltip: We've been recognized as a fully fledged settlement!  Our work is starting to pay off.

lack_of_safety.tooltip: Without some form of city guard, I just don't feel at ease in this wilderness.

petty_theft.tooltip: Someone stole something from our supplies! We need better defenses.

tired.tooltip: It's been awhile since I've slept.

exhausted.tooltip: It feels like forever since I've slept.. I can barely keep my eyes open.

fatigued.tooltip: I've been on my feet for too long. I really need some time to sleep.

panicked.tooltip: I'm not proud of how I acted when the monsters came, but it's all I could think to do.

misses_pet.tooltip: Although it's been awhile since they died, I still catch myself sometimes looking for my pet, [str(pet_name)].

nuzzled.tooltip: Aww, [str(pet_name)] always manages to cheer me up.

plant_lover.tooltip: Everytime I interact with plants I feel a bit calmer.

fruitful_labors.tooltip: It always feels good to make something with one's own hands. It helps clear my mind.

idle_hands.tooltip: I've not made anything in awhile and feel like a layabout. Isn't there something I can craft?

protected_the_town.tooltip: We fended off a group of nasties recently, it really got my blood pumping!

loves_their_job.tooltip: This is the perfect job for me! I love what I do day to day.

townmember_died.tooltip: A fellow townmember has died. If only we had been more watchful!

pet_died.tooltip: My poor [str(pet_name)] passed away recently. I'll miss them quite a bit.

shield_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling to a knight

cloth_padded_vest.description: Provides light protection in a fight.

cloth_padded_vest_iconic.description: Provides light protection in a fight. Every little bit helps!

iron_mail.description: A full suit of iron armor

iron_mail_iconic.description: A full suit of iron armor

steel_mail.description: A full suit of steel armor

steel_mail_iconic.description: A full suit of steel armor

steel_shield.description: A sturdy shield made from steel

steel_circlet.description: Light weight and strong protection for one's head

simple_quiver.description: A light quiver of slowing arrows

fire_quiver.description: Sets enemies on fire, dealing damage over time

cobblestone_fence_gate_ghost.description: It's thick stone walls grant a sense of security.

picket_fence_ghost.description: If it's not white, is our life unfulfilled?

picket_fence_gate_ghost.description: Don't like your neighbors? Don't install.

wooden_double_door_ghost.description: A larger door. It makes quite an impression.

wooden_window_frame_tall_ghost.description: Extra height adds an air of elegance

golden_clay_doorframe_ghost.description: Matches a golden clay exterior wall

blue_clay_door_ghost.description: Blue like a dream of ocean

green_clay_window_frame_ghost.description: Lets in the soft desert air.

latticed_clay_window_frame_ghost.description: The lattice still lets the good air in.

stone_tunnel_door_ghost.description: Useful for sealing off mine tunnels.

clay_tunnel_door_ghost.description: Useful for sealing off mine tunnels

iron_door_ghost.description: Studier than wooden or stone doors

wooden_door_2_fine_ghost.description: Sturdier than your average door, and such a sweet pattern too.

wooden_double_door_fine_ghost.description: A larger door with some extra style. All your friends will be envious.

wooden_window_frame_tall_fine_ghost.description: Extra height adds an air of elegance

picket_fence_fine_ghost.description: If it's not white, is our life unfulfilled?

picket_fence_gate_fine_ghost.description: Don't like your neighbors? Don't install.

green_latticed_window_ghost.description: The latticed window you know and love, now in green!

tan_latticed_window_ghost.description: The latticed window you know and love, in tan

tall_clay_window_ghost.description: Still lets in the soft desert air

log_pile_ghost.description: Harvest for a large number of logs

stone_pile.description: Harvest for many hunks of stone

clay_pile.description: Harvest for a large amount of clay

wheat_pile.description: Harvest for a large amount of wheat

large_crate_fine_ghost.description: Stores up to 32 items. With style.

leather_bound_chest_fine_ghost.description: Stores up to 64 items. With style.

sheep.unripe_description: This sheep is still quite naked.

woodchuck.description: A voracious eater of almost everything, especially logs.

brightbell_crop.description: Can be used as a healing herb

carrot_crop.description: Fast-growing, but pretty bland on its own.

frostsnap_crop.description: Can be used as a healing herb

gingercap_crop.description: Fast-growing staple crop, but not particularly nutritious nor delicious.

pumpkin_crop.description: Big, round, and fast-growing, but tasty it is not.

watermelon_crop.description: Takes a while to grow, but very fun to eat!

silkweed_crop.description: This plant's fiber can be spun into thread

000.name: Silkweed seedling
000.description: Still a long way to grow.

003.name: Immature silkweed
003.description: Flossy hairs are beginning to emerge

tester_silkweed_crop.description: This plant's fiber can be spun into thread

turnip_crop.description: Fast-growing staple crop, but not particularly nutritious nor delicious.

oak_tree_crop.description: Out of trees? Get ready to participate in reforestation.

003.name: Oak Tree Sapling
003.description: Ready to be transferred to a bigger plot.

000.name: Acorn
000.description: Even a mighty tree has humble beginnings.

002.name: Oak Tree Sprout
002.description: Reach for the sun, little oakling.

turnip_shooter_recipe.flavor: Don't like the taste of turnips? Don't worry, they're multi-functional.

critter_trap_recipe.description: Deals a small amount of damage and shortly stuns enemies.
critter_trap_recipe.flavor: A slight annoyance for ogres. A death wish for mice.

iron_door_recipe.description: Thick, sturdy iron door. Also comes with a thick, sturdy lock.

wooden_sign_engineer_recipe.description: A sign with the mark of the Engineer.

inventiveness_2_buff.description: The engineer can repair doors more efficiently

farmer_description.description: Farmers till fields and harvest crops, providing a consistent food supply and raw materials for baked goods.

level_6_data.perk_000_description: Occasionally, the farmer's special touch yields... special results.
level_6_data.title: Master Farmer

level_1_data.perk_000_description: Running fresh food from field to table has increased the farmer's footspeed.

level_2_data.perk_000_description: Exposure to fresh food has given the farmer ideas about cooked food. See the promotion menu for details.

level_3_data.perk_000_description: The farmer coaxes greater yield from each plant.

speed_1_buff.description: Running fresh food from field to table has increased the farmer's footspeed.

farmer_hoe_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Farmer.

footman_description.description: The Footman is a melee fighter. A good choice for the backbone of your town's defense.

level_4_data.perk_000_description: The footman is now practiced at optimizing the effect of each blow.

level_1_data.perk_000_description: The footman knows that all combats may have mortal consequences, and attacks with renewed determination.

level_3_data.perk_000_description: This powerful, overhead swing deals double damage.

level_2_data.perk_000_description: The footman charges into battle with speed

level_5_data.perk_000_description: A slashing strike that deals damage to up to 4 enemies around the footman's target

damage_1_buff.description: At Level 1, the footman attacks with increased ferocity

damage_2_buff.description: The footman attacks with increased ferocity

damage_3_buff.description: At Level 6, the footman's attacks are unstoppable!

footman_outfit.description: Standard issue gear for all soldiers

mason_description.description: The Mason crafts building materials and decorative items from stone.

workshop.name: Mason's Workshop
workshop.long_description: The Mason crafts building materials and decorative items from stone.

level_6_data.title: Master Mason
level_6_data.perk_000_description: The mason's mastery of his trade allows him to come up with completely new ways of using wood.

level_2_data.perk_000_description: The mason can now make more elaborate items froms stone.

level_4_data.perk_000_description: The mason ventures from the realm of the functional into... art.

level_1_data.perk_000_description: The mason can now make a solid array of basic furniture.

level_3_data.perk_000_description: When inspiration strikes, the mason may embellish his works in unexpected ways.

mason_chisel.description: Tools of the trade for a mason.

mason_chisel_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a mason.

mason_hammer.description: Tools of the trade for a mason.

mason_workbench_ghost.description: Used by the Mason for crafting.

bird_bath_recipe.description: A decorative stone vase with water for the birdies.

blacksmith_hammer_recipe.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Blacksmith.
blacksmith_hammer_recipe.flavor: From the dragon that lives in the forge, weapons and armor, defense and conquest.

potter_cutter_recipe.description: Allows a hearthling to make tools and goods from clay.
potter_cutter_recipe.flavor: And Monkey struck the earth with his staff. 'For you are my children, he said, and you shall want for nothing.'

cobblestone_fence_gate_recipe.description: It's thick stone walls grant a sense of security.
cobblestone_fence_gate_recipe.flavor: Sheep go in, but can't get out!

cobblestone_fence_recipe.flavor: Use the earth itself to form the walls of the pasture? Genius!

cook_spoon_recipe.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Cook.

gargoyle_recipe.description: Gothic-style carving to decorate your walls.
gargoyle_recipe.flavor: Remnants of the servants of Brelor, Crownless King.

stone_bench_recipe.description: Outdoor seating for moments of relaxation.
stone_bench_recipe.flavor: Pretty and functional. Matches the tombstones.

stone_brazier_recipe.description: A small fire pit that provides comfort and warmth at night.
stone_brazier_recipe.flavor: Warning: Do not drop anything in while it's lit.

stone_bricks_recipe.description: A key component of stone structures like castles and roads.
stone_bricks_recipe.flavor: Tis a lucky thing, boy, that the square is the natural shape within most rocks. --Garen Knapper

stone_chair_recipe.description: Not horribly comfortable, but a symbol of status.

stone_chest_recipe.description: Imposing place to put up to 64 things.
stone_chest_recipe.flavor: 'Listen up, kid. All the chests in Hemgorir-Under-Mountain looked like this.'--Edolf, Wandering Bard

stone_garden_lantern_recipe.description: An ancient-looking lantern with great ambiance.

stone_maul_recipe.flavor: A modern adaptation of an ancient weapon.

stone_table_recipe.description: It's considerable weight gives it a sense of gravitas. For serious business only.
stone_table_recipe.flavor: No lions were harmed in its construction.

stone_wall_lantern_recipe.description: Attaches to the walls of buildings, providing light
stone_wall_lantern_recipe.flavor: Cons: Heavy. Pros: Unlikely to burn itself down.

tower_brazier_recipe.description: Fashioned after a castle tower, it provides a strong beacon at night.
tower_brazier_recipe.flavor: Great for lining garden paths and intimidating guests.

mason_workbench_recipe.description: Required to produce most of the Mason's recipes.
mason_workbench_recipe.flavor: Tappety-tap; Make the earth sing, Raise Brelor's ghost, Watch the mountain take wing.

mason_pedestal_recipe.description: A well lit place for creating stone artwork.
mason_pedestal_recipe.flavor: Snap and spark, hiss of coal, light the way, transmute the earth whole.

stone_pile_recipe.description: A pile of rocks stacked together. An excellent way to store lots of stone for later use.

stone_tunnel_door_recipe.description: Useful for sealing off mine tunnels.

firepit_recipe.flavor: Fire is life, ashes are death, in these stones, the story of our people. -- Cid

valor_statue_recipe.description: A monument to your town's military might
valor_statue_recipe.flavor: The shield for resiliance, and the sword for strength. -- Cid, Knight of the Old Ways

roadside_shrine_recipe.description: Place to show generosity and faith
roadside_shrine_recipe.flavor: Cid fashioned his breastplate into a basket and brought the wealth of the rich to the bedsides of the poor --Edison Arn, Church of Plenty

craftsman_statue_recipe.description: Shows each craftsman at their best
craftsman_statue_recipe.flavor: A good crafter never blames his tools, only the people who make his tools. --Otto Crankfrown, Guildmaster Emeritus

potter_description.description: Makes useful goods from clay. Upgradeable to the Mason

workshop.name: Potter's Wheel
workshop.long_description: The Potter crafts useful goods and decorative items from clay.

level_3_data.perk_000_description: When inspiration strikes, the potter may embellish his/her works in unexpected ways.

level_6_data.title: Master Potter
level_6_data.perk_000_description: The potter has rediscovered ancient secrets of the Phoenix...

level_2_data.perk_000_description: The potter can now make decorative items to liven up the town or sell for money.

level_4_data.perk_000_description: The potter can now add precious metals to vases and tiles.

level_1_data.perk_000_description: The potter can now make basic furniture and building adornments.

small_urn_recipe.description: For compactly storing up to 8 items
small_urn_recipe.flavor: Mischevious kids break these pots all the time, looking for treasure.

large_urn_recipe.description: For compactly storing up to 32 items
large_urn_recipe.flavor: Once we put things in, how will we get them out? Don't think about it too much

clay_lamp_recipe.description: Its flame brings a warm glow at night.
clay_lamp_recipe.flavor: And the Djinni said to Rayya: 'I have but one last wish to grant. Word it well.'

clay_wall_lamp_recipe.description: Its flame brings a warm glow at night.
clay_wall_lamp_recipe.flavor: 'Close round us guard the spirits of night! As they dance and sway, free you'll be to dream the dark away.'

potter_workbench_recipe.description: Helps the potter create simple items from clay
potter_workbench_recipe.flavor: Where we've been before, we'll be again, round once more, for strength and then--

potter_kiln_recipe.flavor: 'Through heat and hardship we realize our final selves.' -Silora, Acolyte of Rayya's Mystery

clay_safety_standard_recipe.description: Use to designate a safety point
clay_safety_standard_recipe.flavor: To achieve an ideal standard of living, find safety in numbers. --Mysteries and Proverbs, V

clay_bricks_recipe.description: Used to make structures that stay cool even in great heat.
clay_bricks_recipe.flavor: 'And when Clay emerged from the Kiln, he had become Brick, and no matter how hard Sun blasted him, he remained cheerful.'

red_clay_door_recipe.flavor: "The red hints at a mystery, allure. What lies beyond yon red door?" -- Ember Iskender, Dept of Applied Poetry

red_clay_window_frame_recipe.flavor: "Industry standard for a reason" -- Jorya Iskender, Dyemaster

blue_clay_door_recipe.description: Blue like the dream of distant ocean.
blue_clay_door_recipe.flavor: 'It's a door. What more could we possibly say?' --Joni Iskender, Marketing Apprentice

green_clay_door_recipe.description: Green, like the few scrub in the desert.
green_clay_door_recipe.flavor: 'Can you make the hole a bit smaller? The point is to see who it is without giving away that I'm home.' --Vara Tenter, Irate Customer

blue_clay_window_frame_recipe.description: Lets in the bright desert air.
blue_clay_window_frame_recipe.flavor: The dye is named Santori, for an acolyte who longed for the ocean.

green_clay_window_frame_recipe.description: Let's in the soft desert air.
green_clay_window_frame_recipe.flavor: It's a window's dream of spring...?

latticed_clay_window_frame_recipe.description: The lattice still lets the good air in.
latticed_clay_window_frame_recipe.flavor: As the shadows move across the floor, child, see if you can find Monkey!

clay_bed_recipe.description: Uncomfortable, but it gets you off the ground
clay_bed_recipe.flavor: "It's like a pot, for sleeping!" - Clarence, Temporary Salesperson

clay_dining_table_recipe.description: Gets your food off the ground!

simple_clay_chair_recipe.flavor: 'Nests with the tables, ooo, symbolic!' --Nestor Adya, Acolyte

decorative_teapot_recipe.flavor: 'Wherever she went, the teapot did too, and even when there was nothing but cold water to put in, always out poured steaming tea, redolent with the aroma of Elsewhere.'

decorative_tray_recipe.flavor: 'Sugar, spice, and blood of the earth: it is the tray that brings them, and us, together' --Rayya

potted_cactus_recipe.description: Plant a cactus in a clay pot.

blown_glass_vase_recipe.flavor: They say Monkey had one eye made of glass, and through it, he could see straight to the heart of things. --Master Orlen

decorative_vase_recipe.flavor: It is the riches of the earth reborn

sundial_recipe.flavor: The secret to immortality is to make best of days last forever --Rayya

tile_floor_mosaic_recipe.flavor: Step over the painted flowers, and give thanks

golden_clay_wall_planter_recipe.flavor: Where do the flowers come from? From the planter, of course! --Acolyte of Rayya's Mystery

unfired_clay_vase_recipe.description: A simple vase made on the pottery wheel that is used for more complex recipes.
unfired_clay_vase_recipe.flavor: 'The First Pot was formed together by wind, earth, and fire, connecting the people to Hearth' --Master Orlen

clay_pile_recipe.description: A pile of clay stacked together. An excellent way to store lots of clay for later use.
clay_pile_recipe.flavor: Amazing, honestly, that it comes apart again.

clay_market_stall_recipe.description: Merchants can visit this stall to buy and sell goods
clay_market_stall_recipe.flavor: 'Cut off his hand? For theft? What would be the point?' --Talidor Roq, Knight of Mysteries

clay_tunnel_door_recipe.description: Useful for sealing off mine tunnels.
clay_tunnel_door_recipe.flavor: Speak friend and enter.... oh no wait it's not locked. - Eber, Potter's Apprentice

tan_latticed_window_recipe.description: The latticed window you know and love, in tan
tan_latticed_window_recipe.flavor: "Lets in the bugs, but at least not the really big ones!" -- Drenkar Iskender, Ex-Marketing Associate

tall_clay_window_recipe.description: Still lets in the soft desert air
tall_clay_window_recipe.flavor: "Windowsill can cool a really tall pie" -Aaryn, Pragmatist

tan_clay_window_frame_recipe.flavor: "No, I didn't forget the dye." -Isfan Dorret, Inventor of Achromatism

green_latticed_window_recipe.flavor: Reminicent of a vine-covered treehouse window, faded into memory
green_latticed_window_recipe.description: The latticed window you know and love, now in green!

blue_latticed_window_recipe.flavor: "No but really, where is this dye coming from?" -- Farah, Professional Bugcatcher

wooden_sign_potter_recipe.flavor: Less fragile and easier than hanging a real pot!

potter_kiln_ghost.description: Produces bricks and goods from clay.

potter_cutter.description: Used to form civilization from dirt!

potter_cutter_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Potter.

potter_outfit.description: Earth splotches are part of its intense style.

level_4_data.perk_000_description: The trapper has become more efficient at packing in the loot.

speed_1_buff.description: Long walks have increased the trapper's foot speed.

trapper_knife_talisman.description: Required to promote a hearthling into a Trapper.

fur_rug_recipe.flavor: Perfect for an evening by the fire.

leather_bolt_recipe.description: Prepared sheets of leather, ready to be put to good use.
leather_bolt_recipe.flavor: You can hardly see the individual sources.

leather_vest_recipe.description: Hardened leather provides study protection against light weapons.

plushie_toy_rabbit_recipe.description: A toy... for children of course.

spool_of_thread_recipe.description: Needed for cloth. Warm and fluffy
spool_of_thread_recipe.flavor: Each gram of fiber yearns to become a sweater.

tapestry_wall_recipe.description: A decorative scene, woven in colored thread and cord.
tapestry_wall_recipe.flavor: What you see in its knotted depths tells you something about yourself.

thread_recipe.description: Needed for cloth. Warm and fluffy
thread_recipe.flavor: Each gram of fiber yearns to become a sweater.

throw_rug_recipe.description: Brightens up that old dusty floor.

worker_outfit_2_recipe.description: Double stitching and strategically placed padding improves the worker's efficiency. The worker who dons this upgrade outfit will move faster.

weaver_loom_recipe.description: Add thread to thread till cloth results.

weaver_spinning_wheel_recipe.description: Spins prickly, scratchy, chaos into thread.

weaver_workbench_recipe.description: Used to make complex crafts of thread and fabric.
weaver_workbench_recipe.flavor: In the beginning there was nothing, and then there was Spider.

simple_quiver_recipe.description: A quiver equippable by an archer. Stores freezing arrows that will slow enemies

fire_quiver_recipe.description: Gives an Archer access to fire arrows, which deal damage over time

cloth_padded_helmet_recipe.flavor: Were they phoenix wings, or serpent wings?

weaver_loom_ghost.description: Used to weave thread into cloth.

weaver_workbench_ghost.description: Used by the Weaver for crafting.

workshop.long_description: Allows the Herbalist to craft healing balms and bandages.

scenario_data.message: If we're going to get this town off the ground, we'll need wood, and lots of it! Chop down some nearby trees to get logs.
scenario_data.completed_message: Congratulations! We've got some wood resources now. Logs and other natural resources can be used to construct buildings and craft items. They're the first building blocks for advancing your town.
scenario_data.title: [str(i18n_data.town_name)] Town: Initial Supplies

step001.title: Click the Gather button
step001.description: Use the gather button to chop down trees

step000.title: Click the Harvest menu button
step000.description: Use the Harvest menu to gather resources from the world

step006.title: Click stamper to approve the promotion

step004.title: Click Change Jobs to promote this hearthling to a different job

step001.title: Open the Citizens manager
step001.description: Use this pane to manage all your citizens, view their stats, and set their task orders.

step000.title: Promote a Hearthling to a Carpenter
step000.description: We have logs and a place to store goods, but the town is looking pretty empty. Fortunately, we've brought a saw along with us. Let's promote a citizen to a Carpenter!

step007.title: Town Crafters
step007.description: Carpenters and other crafters can create various goods to help your settlement, from beds, to building materials, to weapons.

step003.title: Mouse over the numbers to learn what each attribute does
step003.description: Each hearthling has a Mind, Body, and Spirit attribute that affects how well they do certain things.
